title: What is React?
description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components and manage the application's state efficiently.

title: How does useState work in React?
description: The useState hook is used to add state to functional components. It returns a state variable and a function to update it.

title: What is the difference between var, let, and const in JavaScript?
description: Var is function-scoped, while let and const are block-scoped. Const is used for values that should not be reassigned, while let allows reassignment.

title: How do promises work in JavaScript?
description: Promises represent asynchronous operations. They can be in one of three states: pending, fulfilled, or rejected. Promises allow for better management of asynchronous tasks.

title: What is the Virtual DOM in React?
description: The Virtual DOM is a lightweight in-memory representation of the real DOM in React. It improves performance by only updating parts of the DOM that have changed.

title: What is the use of the Flexbox in CSS?
description: Flexbox is a CSS layout model that allows items within a container to be aligned and distributed with equal space, making responsive designs easier to create.
